JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with ORG ( Sąd Rejonowy ) a counterclaim for payment against the “ LAW operative ( PERSON “ PERSON ” ) . The proceedings for payment instituted by the housing co - operative had been pending since DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a motion for joinder of the cases .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court held a hearing ; however it did not give any decision on the applicant 's motion .

CARDINAL . After DATE and DATE , on DATE , the court gave a decision that the case should be examined separately in another set of proceedings and returned the statement of claim to the applicant because of procedural shortcomings . The applicant lodged an interlocutory appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) quashed the first - instance decision and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date ORG again returned the statement of claim to the applicant because of procedural shortcomings . The applicant lodged another interlocutory appeal .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the contested decision and remitted the case .
CARDINAL . Hearings scheduled for DATE and DATE were adjourned as another case had been given priority .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG gave a default judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court supplemented the judgment by ordering its immediate enforceability .
CARDINAL . On DATE the defendant filed an objection ( sprzeciw ) against the default judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the order of immediate enforceability .

CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE ORG held hearings . Hearings scheduled for DATE and DATE were adjourned due to the absence of CARDINAL of the witnesses . On DATE and CARDINAL DATE the court held hearings .
CARDINAL . The case is still pending before the first - instance court .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG under LAW on complaints about a breach of the right to a trial within a reasonable time ( LOC o skardze na naruszenie prawa strony do rozpoznania sprawy w postępowaniu sądowym bez nieuzasadnionej zwłoki ) ( “ the CARDINAL Act ” ) .
CARDINAL . The applicant sought a ruling that the length of the proceedings before ORG had been excessive and an award of just satisfaction in the amount of MONEY ( ORG ) ( approx . MONEY ( ORG ) ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the complaint . The court did not analyse the conduct of the trial court . It limited its consideration to the applicant 's conduct , namely to the fact that she had made use of her procedural rights , which , in the court 's view , had led to delays in the proceedings .

CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings , in particular the applicable provisions of LAW , are stated in the ORG 's decisions in the cases of ORG v. GPE no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ( dec . ) , § § DATE , ECHR CARDINAL-V and NORP v. GPE no . CARDINAL ( dec . ) , ORG CARDINAL-VIII and the judgment in the case of GPE v. GPE , no . CARDINAL , § § DATE , ORG CARDINAL
